channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large failed repair pothole, 19th March
item.description:
Old pothole with a failed repair close to the centre of the road. On Hewlett Road down from Berkhampstead School.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 157, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entire road is undrievable with the number of potholes!, 18th March
item.description:
The road is a disaster and incredibly unsafe. People swerving to avoid potholes, damage to cars having to go over the potholes. They are bigger than it will let us register on the drop down! No attempt to fix it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 267, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red light on opposite corner of cross-roads also not working., 18th March
item.description:
Eastern side of junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Traffic light timings changed since road resurfacing work on Hucclecote road, 18th March
item.description:
The traffic lights at the end of Hucclecote road at the crossroads leading to delta way/Brockworth (traffic lights number 24&25 I think ) change too quickly. Traffic gets backed up down to the next set of traffic lights opposite and on Folland Avenue. This therefore means getting out of Folland Avenue at the busier times becomes difficult as traffic is backed up and you get stuck trying to go when the light is green. These lights are also on a timer now which is completely unnecessary - please change these back to sensor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: A pathway where a small area of the pavement has broke. There is a much bigger risk of much larger parts of the pavement around this area caving in. It serves as a big safety risk for people walking along this path., 18th March
item.description:
The street that goes in opposite Badham pharmacy. Keep going down and make a turn on the first left. Then at the end of this road you will see it. I’m not sure how long this issue has been present.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Portland Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of potholes, 18th March
item.description:
Middle of the road on Harp Hill. Causing vibration and sound nuisance as large volume of vehicles hit them on a daily basis. Been present for a couple of months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Crossing needs attention, 18th March
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing Stoke Road / A435 is covered in mud, debris and has semi permanent puddles due to the degraded road surface and accumulated vegetation. This is making it almost unusable for pedestrians on a key safe route to schools and shops

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 18th March
item.description:
No bicycles, Footpath only sign as gone. Post and brackets still there.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in middle of single track road, 18th March
item.description:
Large pothole at the Elmstone Hardwicke end of Cursey lane. Is visable when driving towards a38 but not when driving towards Elmstone Hardwicke in the dark, it popped my tyre!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cursey Lane, Elmstone Hardwicke, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road surface creating water damage to verge, 18th March
item.description:
Heavy trucks using Bushcombe Lane to supply various building works have caused the road surface to sink creating pockets and channels of water to flow alongside verges and driveways. This has resulted in turfed/grass verges to die. An ongoing drainage problem on the corner of Bushcombe Close with Bushcombe Lane is adding to the problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Hole in road, 18th March
item.description:
In middle of road, outside no. 45. Previously reported approximately 3 weeks ago and eventually notified it had been fixed but it hasn't. Unfortunately, I have deleted email with reference.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large pothole, 18th March
item.description:
Outside 73 Large pothole Highways came and filled one of the large potholes today 18/03/24 but have left this one! It’s classed as the emergency size.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General lack of maintenance., 18th March
item.description:
The whole of Laxton Walk is looking a shambles. Pavements and borders are covered in weeds, glass, rubbish and dog mess. Thick moss on the pavement at the end creating a slip hazard. Plants are growing out onto the walk making it very dark and intimidating. It would probably just need a mini sweeper and some drain clearing to be nice again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Laxton Walk, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bag of dog dirt on road, 18th March
item.description:
Please could this be cleaned up? thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
